title: James Milner reveals Jurgen Klopp's relationship with Liverpool players
text:
James Milner has lifted the lid on Jurgen Klopp's relationship with his Liverpool players.

And he says the German manager has found the perfect balance between knowing when to put arm round the shoulder and when to give the players a rocket.

The European champions missed out on last season's Premier League title by one point but have started with eight wins from eight games this year to establish an eight-point stranglehold over Manchester City already.

James Milner has lifted the lid on Jurgen Klopp's relationship with his Liverpool players

'The biggest thing with the manager is that what you see is what you get,' Milner told the club's official website.

'He doesn't have one front for the cameras and then he's completely different with the players.

'He's honest with the players and he lives every minute of it. He's on the side and he's bouncing around, he wants to be out there. That energy's big for us when we're down.

'He seems to judge it right, when to put an arm round the shoulder after a game. If we haven't played well or something, he knows what to say at half-time, or if you need a rocket he'll give you that as well. He seems to judge those situations very well.'
description: Milner says the German manager has found the perfect balance between knowing when to put arm round the shoulder and when to give the players a rocket.
